title: Upper bounds for measures on distal classes
abstract:
In recent work, Harman and Snowden introduced a notion of measure on a
Fra\"iss\'e class $\mathfrak{F}$, and showed how such measures lead to
interesting tensor categories. Constructing and classifying measures is a
difficult problem, and so far only a handful of cases have been worked out. In
this paper, we obtain some of the first general results on measures. Our main
theorem states that if $\mathfrak{F}$ is distal (in the sense of Simon), and
there are some bounds on automorphism groups, then $\mathfrak{F}$ admits only
finitely many measures; moreover, we give an effective upper bound on their
number. For example, if $\mathfrak{F}$ is the class of ``$s$-dimensional
permutations'' (finite sets equipped with $s$ total orders), we show that the
number of measures is bounded above by approximately $\exp(\exp(s^2 \log{s}))$.
